titles.title: Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
A bill to adjust the boundary of the Arapaho National Forest, Colorado, and for other purposes.
Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 115-54.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 67.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)
Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
(Sec. 2) This bill adjusts the boundary of the Arapaho National Forest in Colorado to incorporate approximately 92.95 acres of land. The Department of Agriculture shall include all federal land within the boundary in the Bowen Gulch Protection Area established under the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993.
